snippet: The government refused to meet with Taliban representatives after the reported killing of 23 paramilitary soldiers in militant captivity.
abstract: Peace talks between the Pakistani government and the Taliban are suspended in acrimony as a government committee refuses to meet with Taliban representatives in the aftermath of the reported killing of 23 paramilitary soldiers in militant captivity.
lead_paragraph: The government refused to meet with Taliban representatives after the reported killing of 23 paramilitary soldiers in militant captivity.

headline.main: Pakistan Suspends Taliban Peace Talks Over Killings
headline.print_headline: Pakistan: Government Suspends Talks With Taliban
